title: Mingulay
summary: Mingulay (Scottish Gaelic: Miughalaigh)[5] is the second largest of the Bishop's Isles in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland. Located 12 miles (19Â km) south of Barra, it is known for its important seabird populations, including puffins, black-legged kittiwakes, and razorbills, which nest in the sea-cliffs,[6] amongst the highest in the British Isles.[7]
